title: Social Problem-Solving Projects Using Technology-Enhanced Learning (TEL) and Mobile Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Learners use BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) to integrate IMS learning design-based mobile applications and TEL (Technology-Enhanced Learning) tools, solving real-life social problems through project-based learning.

learning_goals: Learners can understand and apply IMS Learning Design standards to mobile applications.
Learners can complete collaborative problem-solving projects using TEL tools with over 80% proficiency

In a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, learners analyze two community issues (e.g., aging population, transportation infrastructure) using smartphones/tablets and public data portals (e.g., National Statistical Portal, Regional Information System), and write a 5-page report (problem definition, data visualization, solutions).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
